Description: Pair of miniature ear-studs: a pair of miniature knobs or ear-studs exactly reproducing the form of the New Kingdom type. They are of opaque orange glass irregularly streaked with red.
Curator's comments: That a New Kingdom form should be revived in this distant, provincial spot seems most improbable. If the knobs are really of the date of the tomb they are presumably imports from Egypt. In this case they are the sole exceptions to a statement that the type was restricted to the late Eighteenth Dynasty. See objects 1952,1213.18 and 1952,1213.19. Bibliography: 'Annals of Archaeology and Anthropology' XI, 168, no. 3 and pl. LIX, no. 3: 'One pair of glass studs'.
